newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian cen.bank changes reserve rules from Nov 1.
newsitem.headline: Russian cen.bank changes reserve rules from Nov 1.

text.p: The central bank is adjusting its reserve requirements from November 1, lowering requirements on some rouble accounts and raising those on foreign currency, a spokesman said on Friday.
The reserve ratio on rouble accounts up to 30 days will fall to 16 from 18 percent.
The ratio on rouble accounts from 31 to 90 days will fall to 13 from 14 percent.
The ratio on rouble accounts of 91 days or over is unchanged at 10 percent.
The ratio on foreign currency accounts rises to 5.0 from 2.5 percent.
The central bank cut reserve requirements in late July, increasing banks' liquidity.

The move reversed a tightening imposed in June as part of a package of measures to neutralise the impact of increases in money supply and of a decision to transfer five trillion roubles of central bank profits to the government.
